aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Supplier Relationship Risks
Amazon has significant suppliers, including content licensors.
Amazon has significant suppliers, including technology licensors.
Amazon has limited-source suppliers that are important to its sourcing.
Amazon has single-source suppliers that are important to its sourcing.
Amazon has suppliers that are important to its services.
Amazon has suppliers that are important to its manufacturing.
Amazon has suppliers that are important to any related ongoing servicing of merchandise.
Amazon has suppliers that are important to any related ongoing servicing of content.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee availability of merchandise.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee availability of content.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee availability of components.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee availability of services.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee particular payment terms.
Amazon does not have long-term arrangements with most of its suppliers to guarantee the extension of credit limits.
Suppliers may decide to limit selling merchandise to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to stop selling merchandise to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to limit licensing content to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to stop licensing content to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to limit selling components to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to stop selling components to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to limit selling services to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may decide to stop selling services to Amazon on acceptable terms.
Suppliers may delay delivery to Amazon.
Supplier decisions may result from one or more supplier bankruptcies due to poor economic conditions.
Supplier decisions may result from natural disasters.
Supplier decisions may result from human-caused disasters.
Supplier decisions may result from public health crises.
Supplier decisions may result from geopolitical events.
Supplier decisions may result from other unspecified reasons.
Supplier decisions may result in Amazon being unable to procure alternatives from other suppliers in a timely manner.
Supplier decisions may result in Amazon being unable to procure alternatives from other suppliers in an efficient manner.
Supplier decisions may result in Amazon being unable to procure alternatives from other suppliers on acceptable terms.
Supplier decisions may result in Amazon being unable to procure alternatives from other suppliers at all.

text:
##### Our Supplier Relationships Subject Us to a Number of Risks

We have significant suppliers, including content and technology licensors, and in some cases, limited or single-sources of supply, that are important to our sourcing, services, manufacturing, and any related ongoing servicing of merchandise and content. We do not have long-term arrangements with most of our suppliers to guarantee availability of merchandise, content, components, or services, particular payment terms, or the extension of credit limits. Decisions by our current suppliers to limit or stop selling or licensing merchandise, content, components, or services to us on acceptable terms, or delay delivery, including as a result of one or more supplier bankruptcies due to poor economic conditions, as a result of natural or human-caused disasters (including public health crises) or geopolitical events, or for other reasons, may result in our being unable to procure alternatives from other suppliers in a timely and efficient manner and on acceptable terms, or at all.
